title: How would one be a good narrator? - Quora

response.answer_text: Master English grammar so that your line readings make exact sense, even in a sentence over a hundred words long. Learn General American dialect or Received Pronunciation. (Other dialects may be useful, but these two are bread-and-butter.) Get into the habit of checking a dictionary to be sure you can pronounce every word—without hesitating. If you get emotional while reading, learn how to turn it off; sometimes emotion is desirable, but you must keep it on a leash. Internalize that it’s “thuh” before consonants and “thee” before vowels.

Start by just trying to be a competent one. Then read, read, read, and write, write, write, and have good writers or editors critique your work. Very few writers make it to the “great” stage, but there’s nothing wrong with aspiring to that. And never stop learning and improving.
